pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we package the technical assumptions that are needed for the small object argument in a typeclass `IsCardinalForSmallObjectArgument I κ` where `I` is a class of morphisms and `κ` is a suitable regular cardinal. This is used in order to define another typeclass `HasSmallObjectArgument I` which asserts the existence of a cardinal `κ` such that `IsCardinalForSmallObjectArgument I κ` holds.

Under the assumption `HasSmallObjectArgument I` we obtain `HasFactorization I.rlp.llp I.rlp` (i.e. any map factors as an "I-cofibration" followed by an "I"-fibration), and `I`-cofibrations are precisely the morphisms which are a retract of a transfinite composition of pushouts of coproducts of maps in `I`.

---

- [x] depends on: #21911
- [x] depends on: #21865
